chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
b: nat
a: nat
n: nat

Goal:
fact n * a = fact n * b -> a = b

Premises:
fact = fix fact (n : nat) : nat := match n with | 0 => 1 | S n0 => S n0 * fact n0 end : nat -> nat Arguments fact _%nat_scope
Nat.div_unique_exact : forall a b q : nat, b <> 0 -> a = b * q -> q = a / b
Nat.div_unique : forall a b q r : nat, r < b -> a = b * q + r -> q = a / b
Nat.mod_unique : forall a b q r : nat, r < b -> a = b * q + r -> r = a mod b
utils_nat.pow2_dec_uniq : forall p a q b : nat, utils_nat.pow2 p * (2 * a + 1) = utils_nat.pow2 q * (2 * b + 1) -> p = q /\ a = b
is_gcd_rel_prime : forall p q g : nat, is_gcd p q g -> exists a b : nat, p = a * g /\ q = b * g /\ is_gcd a b 1
binomial_thm : forall n p : nat, p <= n -> fact n = binomial n p * fact p * fact (n - p)
binomial_spec : forall n p : nat, p <= n -> fact n = binomial n p * fact p * fact (n - p)
fact_S : forall n : nat, fact (S n) = S n * fact n
bezout_rel_prime_lt : forall p q : nat, 0 < p < q -> is_gcd p q 1 -> {a : nat & {b : nat | a * p + b * q = 1 + p * q /\ a <= q /\ b <= p}}
Nat.gcd_divide_r : forall a b : nat, Nat.divide (Nat.gcd a b) b
Nat.gcd_nonneg : forall a b : nat, 0 <= Nat.gcd a b
BinNatDef.N.div_eucl = fun a b : BinNums.N => match a with | BinNums.N0 => (BinNums.N0, BinNums.N0) | BinNums.Npos na => match b with | BinNums.N0 => (BinNums.N0, a) | BinNums.Npos _ => BinNatDef.N.pos_div_eucl na b end end : BinNums.N -> BinNums.N -> BinNums.N * BinNums.N Arguments BinNatDef.N.div_eucl (_ _)%N_scope
Nat.gcd_divide_l : forall a b : nat, Nat.divide (Nat.gcd a b) a
bezout_generalized_lt : forall p q : nat, 0 < p < q -> {a : nat & {b : nat & {g : nat & {l : nat & {u : nat & {v : nat | a * p + b * q = g + l /\ is_gcd p q g /\ is_lcm p q l /\ p = u * g /\ q = v * g /\ a <= v /\ b <= u}}}}}}
binomial_le : forall n p : nat, p <= n -> binomial n p = div (fact n) (fact p * fact (n - p))
fact_0 = eq_refl : fact 0 = 1
Init.Nat.gcd = fix gcd (a b : nat) {struct a} : nat := match a with | 0 => b | S a' => gcd (b mod S a') (S a') end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.gcd (_ _)%nat_scope
rem_lt : forall p : nat, p <> 0 -> forall a : nat, a < p -> rem a p = a
utils_list.list_an_plus : forall a n m : nat, utils_list.list_an a (n + m) = utils_list.list_an a n ++ utils_list.list_an (n + a) m
fact_gt_0 : forall n : nat, 0 < fact n
BinIntDef.Z.quotrem = fun a b : BinNums.Z => match a with | BinNums.Z0 => (BinNums.Z0, BinNums.Z0) | BinNums.Zpos a0 => match b with | BinNums.Z0 => (BinNums.Z0, a) | BinNums.Zpos b0 => let (q, r) := BinNat.N.pos_div_eucl a0 (BinNums.Npos b0) in (BinIntDef.Z.of_N q, BinIntDef.Z.of_N r) | BinNums.Zneg b0 => let (q, r) := BinNat.N.pos_div_eucl a0 (BinNums.Npos b0) in (BinIntDef.Z.opp (BinIntDef.Z.of_N q), BinIntDef.Z.of_N r) end | BinNums.Zneg a0 => match b with | BinNums.Z0 => (BinNums.Z0, a) | BinNums.Zpos b0 => let (q, r) := BinNat.N.pos_div_eucl a0 (BinNums.Npos b0...
utils_list.list_an_spec : forall a n m : nat, In m (utils_list.list_an a n) < -> a <= m < a + n
php.not_list_an_has_dup : forall a n : nat, ~ php.list_has_dup (utils_list.list_an a n)
Nat.eq_mul_1_nonneg : forall n m : nat, 0 <= n -> n * m = 1 -> n = 1 /\ m = 1
Nat.eq_mul_1_nonneg' : forall n m : nat, 0 <= m -> n * m = 1 -> n = 1 /\ m = 1
mult_is_O : forall n m : nat, n * m = 0 -> n = 0 \/ m = 0
Mult.mult_is_one : forall n m : nat, n * m = 1 -> n = 1 /\ m = 1
Nat.eq_mul_0_l : forall n m : nat, n * m = 0 -> m <> 0 -> n = 0
Nat.mul_eq_0_l : forall n m : nat, n * m = 0 -> m <> 0 -> n = 0
Nat.eq_mul_0_r : forall n m : nat, n * m = 0 -> n <> 0 -> m = 0
Nat.mul_eq_0_r : forall n m : nat, n * m = 0 -> n <> 0 -> m = 0
Nat.mul_cancel_r : forall n m p : nat, p <> 0 -> n * p = m * p < -> n = m
div_prop : forall q p n r : nat, q = n * p + r -> r < p -> div q p = n
utils_list.list_an = fix list_an (a n : nat) {struct n} : list nat := match n with | 0 => nil | S n0 => a :: list_an (S a) n0 end : nat -> nat -> list nat Arguments utils_list.list_an (_ _)%nat_scope
divides = fun n k : nat => exists p : nat, k = p * n : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments divides (_ _)%nat_scope
Nat.gauss : forall n m p : nat, Nat.divide n (m * p) -> Nat.gcd n m = 1 -> Nat.divide n p
Nat.mul_assoc : forall n m p : nat, n * (m * p) = n * m * p
Nat.mul_shuffle0 : forall n m p : nat, n * m * p = n * p * m
Nat.eq_mul_0 : forall n m : nat, n * m = 0 < -> n = 0 \/ m = 0
Nat.eq_mul_1 : forall n m : nat, n * m = 1 < -> n = 1 /\ m = 1

```coq
intros H.
apply Nat.eq_mul_1_nonneg in H.
exact H.
Qed.```

original: intros H. apply Nat.eq_mul_1_nonneg in H. apply H.
